Review.Titre: Slow Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Can you imagine dealing with a company where it's impossible to successfully do upgrades? In order to an upgrade you have to go on their web site that assumes what region of the world you're in. You can't change it! That means that if I live in England but ON1 thinks I live in Italy, I will be charged in Euros and not pound sterling. What could be stupider than that? Well, there's more. When I finally did an upgrade, I used a different email address than I used when I bought previous versions of their software. Because of that I was unable to use the software that I downloaded. There is no way of telling them to change the purchase to a different email. If I try to it, it says that the email is already being used. What about customer service? There is none. The only way of contacting them is through a "Submit a request" form. When I detailed my frustration including the invoice number, it responded by a bot that gave me an inane suggestion. There is no phone number and no way to speak to a human. I still am unable to use their software. If you have nothing else to with your time, buy their software otherwise don't bother.My update issue was finally resolved several days later! Now all they have to do is fix the region issue. They told me that when you get to the the pay for order page there is some way of changing the region. It is too late. It should be an immediate option like the language option.

I have requested a refund , my computer though 3 years old does not fit the system. Still no acknowledgment. Very disappointed, I really wanted the product.

Review.Titre: Apparently it is a little lagging in…processing speed.
Review.Contenu: Apparently it is a little lagging in process speed. I’m using the Mac M1 with 16 gig RAM and 1 T storage. And my pics are in JPEG .Also, although there are features improvements from the 2022 s/w that I already own, however herein are some areas that I hope ON1 can improve,1) the crop extension with the fill in the blanks, it not accurate, meaning I still need to touch it up there after.2) I like to have the focus stack & pano stitch functions3) the effects tab are generally antique, as in Luminar , the sun rays are moveable and Luminar Magiclight is able to capture multiple light points altogether , while in ON1 I have to individually add on those effects.Hopefully the June updates have justifiable improvements, otherwise I might have to get a refund and continue with Luminar NEO. Many thanks.RgdsOngToni

Review.Titre: Not sold on ON1, yet…
Review.Contenu: Well, I can’t give a review on customer service yet because I haven’t had any. I paid money, I received your product. I then get emails offering further guides and videos , only to find I have to pay more money to view them. No thanks.Having used ON1Raw for only a week, it’s very overwhelming in terms of having too many micro editing ‘tools’. Video tutorials are only partially helpful, as the videos don’t actually show you how to edit an image from start to finish, the Keyword AI isn’t helpful as it’s not picking up anything in my 1000 images other than ‘high key’ and…there’s no face or people detection? Really? Google has it, for free.On a positive note though…I do like the Super AI Mask function! I will need to find help how to refine the mask when it bleeds onto other parts of the image.I’ll preserve for another week or two.

Review.Titre: The program itself works fine
Review.Contenu: The program itself works fine, but this latest update is extremely “clunky” as far as transporting images between Lightroom. Used to be a really easy click an “edit in” button, image transferred into On1 and then transferred back with ease. I thought this was supposed to be a plug-in to use in conjunction with Adobe. I don’t know if it’s an On1 or an Adobe issue, but having a .cr2 file, then a .psd file, then a copy-.pds, then a .jog and FINALLY a copy-.jpg is a pain in the ass.

Review.Titre: Cool for single Picture edit usage, unusable for professionals
Review.Contenu: ON1 Photo raw is a cool software, however it is not made for heavy duty use and professional things. If you want to make a timelapse or edit big batches of photos, the software comes to its limits. For example: I wanted to edit a timelapse with 4000 photos, which I know is a lot. First, I didn't work at all, always crashed, etc. I divided the photos in to 10 Folder to edit them better, but to my surprise this doesn't really work either. If you want to sync your edits (and I only did small edits) it's gonna be impossible with more than 10 photos.If you want to edit not more than 100 Raw photos you're going to be satisfied, everything over 100 raws and the software is unusable (it's literally unusable I just want to point out what the limits of the software are) If I knew that I would've never bought it, but here we are...

Review.Titre: Always a new problem, always trying to get more money out of you.
Review.Contenu: I'll start off by saying I've used On1 products for over a decade (back when they were "OnOne") and generally enjoyed them! Make a purchase, use the software, everything was great. But over time they kept trying to do more.. They were never "the best" at anything, but they kept adding more tools and features and tried to be a replacement for Photoshop or Lightroom rather than just a plugin. This, over time, created a slower and less-performing program than the earlier releases (which I loved).Over time, they shut down their authentication servers (so no older versions of the software could be reactivated if you had a new computer or fresh install). They replaced these legacy versions with a newer version which again ran slower and worse than earlier versions. It also did not work at all on any Mac computers. The solution: Buy the new versionSo I did. And now rather than a base application and plugins, everything is split into multiple purchases. Buy twice. So I did. And again with updated, the plugins continue to run poorly even on a powerful editing desktop. Customer service has been terrible. I assume their response to this will be "Submit a ticket!", which is pointless. I've tried, I've purchased and re-purchased and then repurchased again (not learning my lesson) and nothing ever gets fixed.Despite buying, I constantly get bombarded with their "Best sale.. EVER!" emails every day. For someone who just bought the software, I don't need 3 emails a week telling me to purchase it. I've unsubscribed but continue to receive them.Don't bother. Look at Luminar, Topaz or even Nik instead.

Review.Titre: Nice but needs work
Review.Contenu: The release of this product was poorly done. So much hype and then so many issues to install and run a licensed copy.  AI Brilliance is not what it is cracked up to be, frequently missing the mark. Personal presets within Lightroom are far more effective and on the money.  Photo Raw Max will not allow imports from Lightroom to open as layers in On1 anymore and is the prime reason I leave Lightroom to go to ON1.  I find the interface is more complex than it needs to be.  AI masking really only handles the simplest of images and I nearly always have to go back to the brush. The brushing, if complex, hangs and becomes jerky after numerous brush strokes.  So, lots of room for improvement and Lightroom will remain at the heart of my workflow.

Review.Titre: Fabulous outcome, just have to dig for user information and guides.
Review.Contenu: All the information, help, and tutorials are buried on the site. Before purchasing something of this liking I prefer to see real life examples of the software, including menus, tools, and how to.  There is not much on You tube (from you as a company) with these examples either. The one for noise is years old, and not informative.  It leaves a lot of your customers wondering and digging for information on how to get all the tools to show, the top menu is locked out when using in PS or LR, but yet no one explains this in the videos you have. Making a user dig for this information is not a plus. I have been in photography and graphic design for over 14 years, and found this confusing, I can bet there are more users feeling the same. There are other software providers that go more in depth and have that information up front and visible, hence my 3 stars instead of 5.

Review.Titre: Still a bit cumbersome
Review.Contenu: I've been using Luminar for a while,  and their interface is so much simpler, plus  they put quick masking brushes in every tool.   I routinely edit thousands of pictures at a time,  so I need a fast editing workflow.  I use large dodge and burn brushes on most photographs, so quick acces to those brushes is important to me.   On1 is getting better,  but the interface is still a bit cumbersome,  especially when using brushes.  The effects module is a bit awkward and i usually don't use it. The perfect software would be Luminar Neo editing interface with On1 file management.

Review.Titre: It may be great software but…
Review.Contenu: It may be great software but, if you are new to using it you have very few resources for learning how to use it to your best advantage. What is a good work flow? Where do you start? So many questions and so few answers.

Review.Titre: I enjoy the the easy handling and…
Review.Contenu: I enjoy the the easy handling and workflow to get beautiful images out of my raw files. This works fine on the computer, but there‘s a huge drawback on the mobile platform: no possibilities to get the images out of the cloud sync either on the apple nor on the windows side (all software are updated). If this cross over would work then it is a superb package.

Review.Titre: Well that is hard to put into words
Review.Contenu: Well that is hard to put into words, when I first joined ON1 it was when you first got going and surprise it cost nothing then, I can't remember what photo editing platform I was with then and ON1 took over, so I have been with ON1ever since, and like everything it costs more every year, sometimes it becomes too expensive, sure I understand you all have be rewarded for all your time and effort may I say it wonder work that you do THANKS . Money get tight sometimes.

Review.Titre: Poor customer setvice
Review.Contenu: Have had two accts for years because of an error made setting up Acct. Cannot get it corrected so it is very difficult to access the program or use it!!! Have made multiple calls but no results!!! Cust service seems only a sales dept.

Review.Titre: I am bulk processing a thousand photos…
Review.Contenu: I am bulk processing a thousand photos from a sports photography shoot.  After rating and processing, I identified around 450 photos for upload to social media.  The actual upload is taking over two hours.  Seems an inordinately long time for process to be completed.  The program is now unusable while the upload is completed.  Not an efficient or effective use of the program. I find the interface confusing (not having a Lightroom background.  With on going usage, processing less bulk upload should become more familiar. Provide an update once skills and knowledge has improved.

Review.Titre: Everything seems to work OK except…
Review.Contenu: Everything seems to work OK except Denise which crashes straight after loading.

Review.Titre: I'm a long time customer, but!
Review.Contenu: I'm a long time customer, over 10 years and not an everyday user. For some reason I have a problem using the software due to all twists and turns regarding the user interface which change sometimes dramatically when a new release is introduced. Ok you have teaching videos but sometimes they make me even more confused as I don't always have the background from previous versions. Wish I could get some easy way into using on1 from start to end.

Review.Titre: I Love ON1 (except when I’m having a technical issue)
Review.Contenu: I love ON1. But I’m having a technical issue that makes the software useless. I thought installing the upgrasded ON1 Effects would solve the issue. I’m working with your technical team but as of now, I can’t use it which distresses me. My entire work flow has been disrupted.

Review.Titre: Just Beginning
Review.Contenu: I just started working through the program, which I intend to use in conjunction with Adobe Lightroom, because I'm intrigued by some of the extra effects you can get with ON 1. However, it's really complicated, and the layout isn't exactly intuitive. Sometimes you use panels on the right for effects, sometimes the tools at the left, sometimes you hold down the mouse key and a panel pops up, sometimes you go to the tool bar at the top. I'll you know when I'm more comfortable with the program

Review.Titre: It works with some quirks.
Review.Contenu: It works, it helps but there are quirks:-It does not support all image file types, -It does not support all picture encoding methods-It gets confused between the metadata's thumbnail and the actual picture.-it can't handle monochrome files (1 channel). -It would be a better tool if it was able to recognize and filter out jpeg compression artefacts-And my main itch: It doesn't work on Linux

Review.Titre: ON1's response to problem did not solve it
Review.Contenu: I puchased ON1 Photo Raw following a trial and, in addition, received some bonus content as presets. Despite following the instructions in the manual I could not load them into the software. I contacted ON1 via a Facebook message and received, the next day, what looked like a stock response that really did not solve the problem. With a bit more experimentation I found I could load the presets (in Windows 11) only if I right-clicked on the file and selected "open with" ON1 Photo Raw as long as Photo Raw was not running. Thus I had to close the software before loading each preset!

Review.Titre: Catalogues: Room for improvement
Review.Contenu: Catalogues can't be saved to another volume. There is only one catalogue and it's on your startup disk. In CaptureOne or Lightroom (or even Photos for macos) I can create several catalogues and save them where ever I like.This means that if you have a lot of photos you can only work in Browse mode …

Review.Titre: Upgraded after several years - OK but not great
Review.Contenu: Upgraded after several years. It has become complicated and more difficult to use and no longer easily intuitive. Charge extra for most video learning courses. Those that are available are tedious and do not answer the question directly but are more personal reflections from the person making the vide. Resize for example offers a few buttons but does not really provide information on what other things are available and how to use them like PS that has popup information when you hover. Masking is another thing that has become very difficult to use. When it works it is great but if you want to step back and figure out how to get what you want you are stuck UNLESS YOU PAY DOUBLE SO YOU CAN SEE THE VIDEO OF HOW TO USE IT.

Review.Titre: The programme has a lot of potential…
Review.Contenu: The programme has a lot of potential and many great features. But I miss the basic Tutorials, which would show the new user all the functions step by step. Especially since some of the tutorials are out of date after updates. In addition, the programme sometimes closes itself or does not save files - which I have reported via the help.

Review.Titre: The Good and Bad
Review.Contenu: What I like: Sky replacement: not perfect but better than PS, compares favorably with Neo. SkySwap AI with some manual masking works very well, especially with PurePixel.Transformations work well.What I would like to see improved:Processing speed -- operations appear to bog down after certain operationsBrowsing through catalog images really slows down after edit operations -- very annoying. Takes a while to bring up a single photo ... switching between layers can also be slow, also annoying. I have a Ryzen 5800X processor and AMD RT 6600 GPU, 64 GB RAM.Better HDR and more HDR presetsI find the UI confusing at times. Probably because I am a longtime PS and Lightroom user.Thank you for listening ... I do like the product and am looking forward to improvements.

Review.Titre: Great Webinar, poor getting to it!
Review.Contenu: This review is in reference to the Summer Photo Editing: Elevate Your Creativity with ON1 Photo RAW!, webinar.I started out trying to log into Zoom, which kept asking me for a PASSWORD, whic was NEVER given to me in any of your correspondence. Then I waited till it ended to attempt to follow your instructions to see it on either YouTube or you webpage. None of the links you posted, in the follow-up email would work. I sent emails to customer service, complaining of my experience, yet nothing they sent me would work. I wound up going through every link on your web page and finally found it in the Video Library.

Review.Titre: Decent software but shouldn’t have to pay for tutorials
Review.Contenu: Decent software with some unique capabilities…but from someone coming over from LightRoom I feel the support is lacking.  If On1 is invested in my success with their software, then tutorial videos should all be free.  This Ala Carte approach is just a hair away from the subscription model which drove me away from LR. I'm giving it a year and if I can't get my productivity back to where I was with LR, I may bit the bullet and go back.

Review.Titre: Normally i am very excited for on1s…
Review.Contenu: Normally i am very excited for on1s products and the new keyword ai brings promise. But after trying other software that does the same its unfinished, slow and not producing usable results. When it does at some point, they will get 5 stars as usual.

Review.Titre: While the technical bugs in audio remained unfixed, our host was terrific.
Review.Contenu: I liked the examples our host provided, to further explain the ways to use the various products in ON1. What I wasn't happy about was the amount of audio problems that consistently covered up his words as he spoke. I therefore felt that I missed a lot of what he was trying to say. Still, it was worth my time, as I was unfamiliar with most of the subject matter he discussed. He clearly cared about his work, and often apologied for the technical trouble.

Review.Titre: Not a simple transistion from Lightroom 5
Review.Contenu: It is difficult to find some of the tools that I use in lightroom.  The help feature does provide the answers, but not on the first or second try.  You must keep digging to find your correct answer.Selecting "foreground" isn't 100% effective, and I've yet to learn how to adjust that.

Review.Titre: Slow, Crashes, Tech No-Support
Review.Contenu: Slow, crashes without warning, "tech support" no real support at all, just gives stock answers blaming the hardware. There are plusses about the application but the minuses outweigh them. I wouldn't / can't use this in a professional workflow environment.

Review.Titre: Crashes to much
Review.Contenu: Crashes to much. The constant increase in size causes it to be progressively slower and slower. Must have at least 32 gigs bytes of memory to operate at descent speed. As it gets bigger it requires constantly up dating your computer. Besides that it’s a great program.

Review.Titre: Essentials all there but performance is poor
Review.Contenu: I shifted from Lightroom / PS to the ON1 platform, I was prepared for the clunky transition of re-learning where all the menu, buttons and options were - it's a bit different but all the essentials seem to be there. What's really let me down is how slow it is, I'm running a reasonable system with Intel i7 processor and IRIS graphics card and all files are stored on an internal SSD but still I'm getting lag between most actions.  Sometimes clearing the cache helps a bit but not long later and the lag and waiting is back, really frustrating when trying to edit lots of RAW images in one session.

Review.Titre: User of the 2023 plugin version from LR
Review.Contenu: User of the 2022 plugin version, I was hoping with the new 2023 that some faults would be solved. Unfortunately not !!From LightRoom, the creation of a .dng file leads to new keywords at the root on LR, not taking into account the structuring of LightRoom keywords !! It's to bad !! I hope for a next release !

Review.Titre: The program has unlimited potential but
Review.Contenu: The program has unlimited potential but. Sometimes the training videos are hard to follow and I have not been able to save some of them. Also I resent being asked to pay an additional fee to get the plus features.

Review.Titre: Liked curves and effects filters
Review.Contenu: Liked curves and effects filters, ease of use. Noise reduction needs work DXO has more refined process, ON1 2023.5 too many geometric artifacts.

Review.Titre: Great product, but horrible support ruins it.
Review.Contenu: I really like the product and the idea that I could do all of my work in a single product, but tethering with my Z9 would not work. I tried working with support to resolve the issue, but I would only get one reply per day at first, and then after sending in my log files, I did not get a reply for four days. During that time, I asked for a response several times and asked for a phone number to call support. The first reply I received was just a link to a 4 year old page about why they don’t have phone support. I replied immediately asking about my issue and log files. They took another hour to reply to say everyone that could help was on vacation and I would need to wait until they returned. At that point, I had to give up and request a refund. I can’t afford to rely on a product/company where I cannot get reasonably quick help for issues.

Review.Titre: Difficult to learn when you are not…
Review.Contenu: Difficult to learn when you are not used to  work on ON1 general application.Linear workflow where you can't go back on a prior adjustment without loosing your work.Workflow tutorial very superficial, Refining the masks can be a painful.

Review.Titre: Good program, wrong purchase.
Review.Contenu: I was disappointed with what I go an what I expected. I tried the one with all the bells and whistles but bought the cheapest one.  My fault for not looking at the selections better. I ended up buying a bunch of plugins and got pretty good results but wish I had purchased the the next level up with most everything. All was not lost as I can use the plugins with Adobe Elements.After a year if I am still around I may purchase the upgrades. I am 87 so is kind of iffy,

Review.Titre: Still waiting
Review.Contenu: It is mildly disappointing to pay for a product and then wait two weeks (and counting) to receive it.

Review.Titre: To be honest
Review.Contenu: To be honest, I dislike it.  One of the several shortcomings is that the zoom to zoom in is not enough.I respond to your answer: I bought the ON1 raw 2023 and you cannot set the zoom, while you really need it on a phone screen.  I have indeed requested a refund.

Review.Titre: Each time I open it can’t show all of…,
Review.Contenu: Each time I open it can’t show all of my catalogued folders, there are 3 so sometimes it 1 sometimes 2, very rarely shows all three without a close and reopen. No ono on one service from the tech support team!

Review.Titre: System requirements
Review.Contenu: System requirements require a huge upgrade in order for me to run ON1 2023.5 Photo Raw, so I never got to experience the wows reviews talk about.

Review.Titre: the software doesn't work on my…
Review.Contenu: the software doesn't work on my computer. The software available is for Intel only and I have an AMD platform. Your tech group cannot help, I will request a refund.

Review.Titre: ON1 captures all  my photos without…
Review.Contenu: ON1 captures all  my photos without permission and blocks/ covers the image with a large blue ugly "gear".How do I prevent this from happening?

Review.Titre: The uploading should be made a lot…
Review.Contenu: The uploading should be made a lot simpler and mine has crashed twice just searching for a file. The editing is sweet no problems with it.

Review.Titre: Need Vulkan
Review.Contenu: After i downloaded 2 of the programs i was instructed i would need Vulkan 1.1 or later. there were no instructions or links where i could get the appropriate Vulkan-whatever that is.I felt like i wasted my money for an item i really want.Jack Tompson

Review.Titre: The purchase downloaded as I was so…
Review.Contenu: The purchase downloaded as I was so keen to update ..I made a mistake and forgot to look at technical specs .,for the moment I have to wait till update my pc

Review.Titre: ON1 will deactivate licenses to force customers to upgrade.
Review.Contenu: UPDATE 3/29/23 I have changed my review from 1 star to 3 because almost four months after my initial review (see below) and after seeing that review, ON1 unexpectedly made things right with my licensing issue. The reason I did not change to 5 stars is because of the experience I initially had with tech support and how they handled the situation with a "too bad" attitude.  The tech support rep didn't seem to care about resolving the actual issue to keep a long time customer.  A poor review shouldn't be the reason to make things right, when it could have been handled before a review was even posted.ORIGINAL REVIEW-Had started using ON1 Photo and ON1 Photo Raw in its beta days (2016).  Liked this software and decided to purchase it.  It had been great for me,  until the company decided to deactivate/expire my license in order to force me to upgrade to new version.  The version I was using met all of my photography needs, I did not see a need to upgrade.  Contacted support with absolutely no help, basically told me I qualify for a discounted upgrade price.   This is how they treat longtime customers.

Review.Titre: ON1 is easy to use and you will get…
Review.Contenu: ON1 is easy to use and you will get fast results.For most of the customers is this enough.I think, your app has no chance against PS or Affinity Photo. The last one is much cheaper than yours.Nice in ON1 is the development of the raw-files

Review.Titre: Disliked that there was no thought for…
Review.Contenu: Disliked that there was no thought for enlarging works of art ..Just photos....Since the tools will be improved with time, and I've invested $200..I'll stick by you for a few months!!!

Review.Titre: Doesn’t connect to photoshop
Review.Contenu: Doesn’t connect to photoshop. Not my working flow. I have to pay extra to get to on 1 from photoshop which is frustrating to me. I ended up not using it that much.

Review.Titre: I like the programs… but sadly the…
Review.Contenu: I like the programs… but sadly the latest update to photo raw won’t work on my computer . Until then everything was excellent.

Review.Titre: Effects and capability -- Excellent… BUT!!!
Review.Contenu: Effects and capability -- Excellent when I wait the time.  I am a novice to the program.  BUT, I am very competent in WIN and Computer stuff.  ISSUES:  Speed of loading -- slow.  It takes too long to load.  It uses too much memory and too much of the CPU and using 4G memory.  Task Manager is pegged out!  And I have a Win10, I7 system.   Power usage Very High, Memory - 4G!  I think it is wasting time in scanning folders -- so what ever, make it only respond when I need it to.  Making a change in the picture and preview -- TOO SLOW.  I hit several buttons to change the photo and it takes forever!  And I actually locked it up. Had to try to close and reopen and it too forever to actually get the WIN 10 system to respond normally.   ALSO -- DAMN-- File Menu:  PLEASE ADD a simple CLOSE File and SAVE AS when I am done to conform with standard WIN menu.   I finished the editing and couldn't figure out how to simply save to a different folder -- I used "EXPORT" -- why can't I find the option "SAVE AS"?  And then CLOSE the file I was editing?  I was never able to actually close the file I was editing.  I like the capabilities, but..... incorporate some of the standard menu options.  In my opinion, you need to incorporate the usual expectations in the menu options and really improve on the speed.  I. e. don't make the program appear to be scanning my computer and wasting my time waiting for it to load and make it available for actually doing the work. Ass I learn the system, I am sure I will have more issues!

Review.Titre: I'm just disappointed that On1 Resize…
Review.Contenu: I'm just disappointed that On1 Resize isn't part of the On1A1 thing.

Review.Titre: The version I was using ran OK  bu the…
Review.Contenu: The version I was using ran OK  bu the latest update of Photo Raw 2023 won't run on my computer. I have to be honest I feel really let down.

Review.Titre: I bought the Plug-in bundle
Review.Contenu: I bought the Plug-in bundle.  However, I thought I was buying ON1's 2023 software BUNDLED with the Plug-ins.  In fact when I first contacted ON1's technical help, the helper (Stevie) did NOT advise me differently - He gave me instructions about how to get rid of the error -4.  He replied to my help request within 24hrs. However, when I replied to Stevie again (several times), he did not respond for 6 (six) days.  I had sent notes about my "discoveries" as I spent many hours trying to install it.  He finally replied (6 days later) and advised me that I had NOT purchased "ON1 Photo Raw 2023.5"!  Well, that solved the issue!  Since I could not use the plug-ins with my version of Photoshop, I requested a refund and it has been issued by ON1.  I quoted my contract # ID: ON1230801-4113-39716 on the first line of my first ask for help.  If Stevie had looked this up, the issue would have been immediately resolved.  However, why was I confused in the first place?  Well, I saw the word "Bundle" on ON1's "sales" promotion page and I thought, "Great!  I can buy the whole package!"  But, as the page told me, "I gotta do it today to get the sale price."  So I did.  I recommend making the page less confusing unless the confusion is your intent.  I recommend a promotion that says, "Download a free trial of ON1 2023 and IF you purchase the software within the trial period, you can purchase the Plug-in bundle for 50% off!"   I also recommend that helpers check the customer's contract before proceeding with any help!!  I wish you success in your business.  I did try the ON1 Raw 2023 software in the free trial.  Unfortunately the file extensions were not recognized.  However, the main issue was that I could not figure our how to "save" my adjusted photos!  Why is that so difficult?  In Photoshop it is just under file/save or save as.  Thanks for the refund.  Dave, 250 493 4228

Review.Titre: As I open the program It stops
Review.Contenu: As I open the program It stops, asks me if I want to report the problem and if I say no it keeps working.

Review.Titre: A problem every time I sign in
Review.Contenu: I have not used the software yet but every time I try to sign in it’s telling me I need to buy the software before I can sign in. That doesn’t make me feel good!

Review.Titre: User experience
Review.Contenu: I missed the capacity of easily being able to move photos from one place to other and also sort them by several criteria options.

Review.Titre: When ON1 Sky Swap AI works well
Review.Contenu: When ON1 Sky Swap AI works well, it's excellent, but it's slow on starting up as a Photoshop plugin (between 10 and 40 seconds of lag time), and it sometimes hangs up completely (and will not start at all), and sometimes -- even once it has started up -- some of the choices in the menus fail to be selected even after clicking on them.

Review.Titre: I purchase their software 4 months ago…
Review.Contenu: I purchase their software 4 months ago when I didn't have any real estate work using it for social media and similar needs. Recently the market picked up and I needed to put it to work. Keeping in mind that I already own 3 other pro-software editing packages, I like the navigation and the features and took the plunge for the most expensive editing software I ever paid for figuring for the beter... now wrong!That all said, for those in the real estate side know that photos, at least on the east coast, have to be uploaded by the real estate agents to MLS PIN, which is the lsiting service for at least 3 or 4 states in this area. They are not seen by the prospect if you don't.Bottom line, there is some sort of glitch in the software that MLS PIN catches and rejects the uploaded .JPG photos. The problem stems from the On1 Photo RAW output file. These images are in .JPG for this service. It makes no difference the title number of characters, the long edge pixel count or the dpi or any combination of! I almost lost several clients due to this. The kicker when I went back to my other software, I was able to load all the images to MLS specifications and even exceeded the limits 250% without any issue or rejection!There is no chat, no phone, and no answering emails. In other words, no customer or technical service. I sent two emails and marked them urgent...So what!  Lost over $250 for the stuff I bought including the 2022.1 version of their elite software. Suggestion: look somewhere else.As an update 04/05/2023, although I love the software otherwise, it is not conducive to the New England MLS for real estate which in itself is strange. However, using other software (three in all) for the same purpose has no issues. The problem continues to point to ON1 with no resolution to date.

Review.Titre: I loved the old version
Review.Contenu: I loved the old version, and I’m slowly getting used to the 2023. The changed filter and preset drop downs aren't as user friendly now now.

Review.Contenu: I just got it. Get back with me. I want to use the 2023 ON1 before I rate it.

Review.Contenu: A teacher should never apologize. . . .

Review.Titre: It’s a great tool
Review.Contenu: It’s a great tool, easier than other platforms, allows me to be more productive.Great online learning content

Review.Titre: I trialed this and Topaz
Review.Contenu: I tried this and Topaz. There wasn't a huge difference between the two but if I was forced to pick one I would say I thought ON1 was slightly better at noise reduction without softening the picture too much and it was slightly cheaper too.

Review.Titre: Definitely a lot quicker
Review.Contenu: Definitely a lot quicker. I'm still not convinced that brilliance AI is material better than auto AI

Review.Titre: Having Been a Photoshop Camera RAW User
Review.Contenu: Having been a Photoshop Camera RAW user for some years. Having looked at other editing suits and not been inpressed, it came has a bit of a shock when i took a look at the pre-release video of ON1 2024 and i was completely 'blown away'.I imediately downloaded ON1 and only having used it for a few days, I cannot wait for the release of ON1 2024, I feel sure it will be my go to RAW aditor, using it in conjunction with Photoshop.

Review.Titre: I have used ON1 software as far back as pre ver. 10.5
Review.Contenu: I have used ON1 software as far back as ver. 10.5.  I usually upgrade every few years.  The last upgrade was to PhotoRaw 2021. Given all the advances, I decided to upgrade to 2024.  Since I have an older computer (2010, HP 170t), I tried the one month trial of  PhotoRaw 2023.  It worked well, so I decided to upgrade to 2024 hoping that it too would work on my old computer.  At the end of the install process, I received an error message saying that my version of DirectX 12 was not compatible.  Surprisingly, though, it appeared on my desktop and I tried it.  Although I really like the new interface, the Brilliant AI did not work, nor did some of the masking features.  Also, I noticed that my older processor was constantly ramping up to warp speed, as should be expected given some of the new features of AI.  So, I have installed 2023 and am going to use that version until I upgrade my computer, which I am dreading, not so much for the expense, but for the labor in transferring, installing, etc.  So, once I get established on the new computer, I will do a more thorough review.  I am an amateur photographer who enjoys editing digital photos, but who is also digitizing a large slide and color negative collection.  I would like to suggest that some information, or perhaps videos on how PhotoRaw could be utilized to accomplish this endeavor would be useful.  I believe ON1's emphasis on customers' needs is paramount in its growing base of users.  As a former resident of the Portland area (only about 5 miles from your office) I wish you well.Michael WallDavisburg, Michigan

Review.Titre: Adobe and ON1 user
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using ON1 for a number of years. My primary software is Adobe LRC/PS as I cut my teeth on Adobe products. Adobe and ON1 complement each other very well. I’m comfortable recommending ON1 to others as their primary editing software if they are not already heavily invested in Adobe products.

Review.Titre: Problem with basic features and interface consistency.
Review.Contenu: On1 pros is a big variety of filters and AI selection options. But in the same time, on1 is far not the best RAW. Main function as RAW converter in not as flexible as competitors, not allows to change significantly image highlights, remove image haze. Curves, levels, vibrance, haze control should be a part if basic image adjustments menu. Images generated from RAW for editing on the screen looks not sharp (maybe because on1 wants to increase speed and responsiveness of user interface). Some Effects tools particularly double each other, like for example color adjustments. I would like to see mask intersection and subtraction options. I need possibly to create mask based on color and tone simultaneously in combination with gradient and brush tools. Album function, not as flexible as collections in Lightroom. So, as a conclusion, on1 should work on basic functionality and tools quality and consistency.

Review.Titre: Very good colour from the raw files…

The noise ai plug in also works much better and faster than Lightroom and has a jpeg option unlike adobe which I find slow and bloated producing large dng files. Review.Titre: Sky Swap
Review.Contenu: I'm writing with regard to the "Sky Swap" app. The number of choices using Sky Swap is great. However, up to this point using blur to soften the noise appears more like a move blur rather than a gaussian blur. I hope development of the No Noise app AI will continue to improve. It's certainly competitive with Topaz and DxO. I want to thank you for your follow through when a member/customer is in need of assistance.

Review.Titre: ON 1 is a useful editing program
Review.Contenu: ON 1 is a useful editing program, however it is not perfect. The AI masking tools work well with some images, identifying the sky, background and foreground with good accuracy. With some images it fails completely identifying the whole image as foreground. The Auto sharp feature is generally too harsh and needs to be manually toned down to achieve the desired effect. I would describe it as a work in progress. I still find that I use other programs to further adjust images after using ON1. When it is on offer it's worth buying but at full price I would not purchase the program.

Review.Titre: ON1 Photo RAW 2023 & Plugins - Comments
Review.Contenu: Dear ON1,Very happy for the new 2023 release, with the six plugin bundles, which makes the ON1 Photo Raw application, more user-friendly, including their own presets.I upgraded from 2021, hoping that with the 2023 Portrait AI, i will be able to change/swap studio portrait backgrounds and keep the subject hair without loosing any details. But is’t not obvious, to do so, and the Portrait AI, doesn’t seem to be dedicated for changing the background ;o(, until now, I’m using Photoshop CS6 to do so.Also note that ON1 Photo Raw 2023 is compatible with Photoshop CS6, the plugins are all included in : PS6 File/Automate and also in PS6 Filter/ON1To conclude:- Hope that the Portrait AI would include and easy way to swap backgrounds and allow an easy way to keep the subject hair into a new background ;o)- ON1 Photo Raw 2023 plus the individual plugins is a great improvement, compared to the older versions, especially version 2021 ;o)- I propose to all ON1 Users to upgrade to the latest version, and include the six plugins.Keep on your great work ;o)SamQuébec City

Review.Titre: ON1 Photo Raw 2023.5 - very useful tool in the toolbox
Review.Contenu: After trying out ON1 Photo Raw on a couple of occasions, I finally purchased version 2023.5 in late July 2023. It's not the only piece of photo asset managing and editing software I have and it is a matter of choosing the preferred tool for a particular job. A Swiss Army Knife may have a lot of attachments but sometimes, say, a specific screwdriver is needed.A really good feature of Raw 2023.5 is the development of raw files. I have both Nikon & Sony cameras and the developed output from NEF and ARW files is great. It's very easy to adjust the tonal rendering and the AI settings are a good starting place - sometimes nothing else is needed. That being said, the AI noise adjustments, particularly on high ISO files from the small sensor on the Sony, are less good and I prefer the classic method. (Another bit of software I have does it better without saying it is "AI" but the colour rendidtion is less pleasing!)On some tests, the focus stacking feature gave quite good "out of the box" results despite being limited to 15 images. On macro subjects I would normally take over 40 images so I would have to have a multi-stage process.I am not bowled over by the AI keyword feature but the auto look-up of location names from the GPS stamp saves a little bit of time.In summary, I will use Raw 2023.5 for development of raw images including various adjustments and colour grading. I do not intend to use it for managing my photo assets nor for more intricate adjustments such as blending several photos.If I didn't have the other software, I would be happy to use most of Raw 2023.5's rich features. It is good value for money.

I'm an avid armature shutter bug at 71 yr old. The price was great  so MANY THANKS for that !!!  YES, i would RECOMMEND ON1. Dwayne.

Review.Titre: Great product, 4.5 stars overall.
Review.Contenu: About 2 years ago I stopped using Adobe and wanted to find an alternative. I explored ON1 and was impressed with the product. While it doesn't offer EVERY feature that lightroom or photoshop does it's an interesting combination of both that provides enough functionality for the vast majority of photo-editing, even including some layering and masking abilities. In my time working with ON1 I've cataloged or edited about 10,000 photos without a problem. I've used the last two versions of ON1 and have noted significant improvements in functions and abilities from one to the next. Also ON1 uses less resources than lightroom making it perfect for those of us who don't have an M1 or M2 MacBook. (yet)they also offer free tutorials on using their project which is similar enough to adobe in front-end accessibility to make the transition quick.The only complaint I have is that sometimes, and I mean just that, not always, but sometimes the company does fall behind on customer service issues. But they have always gotten back to me.

The replacement of skies with Sky Swap Al is very quick and gives good results.The skies included with the app are very nice, but in same cases to dramatic. To keep a personal style is it better, to use then own sky replacements.German users can find video tutorials in german language, also the german edition of ON1 Photo RAW 2022 is a help. Unfortunately there is no german issue of the ON1 Sky Swap Al 2023 User Guide. This Guide-book contents many informations about the program.

Review.Titre: ON1 Everything Subscription…
Review.Contenu: I had an ON1 Everything Subscription 200 GB per year. My mistake was upgrading to ON1 Photo RAW MAX 2024. I contacted customer service for a refund. Less than 1 day later, the refund was made. We took the time to clearly explain the difference between upgrade and subscription. This is the 2nd time I have dealt with customer service. Always fast and courteous service.

Review.Titre: Love It
Review.Contenu: I have had ON1 for some years the learning videos are critical to the experience helping you to get the most out of the product. Recent developments into AI, No Noise and Sharpening help you obtain the best from your photo. Resize I believe could do with further development. The requirement to save it separately adds an unnecessary step to the workflow. Also resize recently has begun turning the DNG file into JPEG. I am looking forward to ON1 RAW 2024. Please don’t go to monthly charging. I enjoy the concept of ownership of the version you sign up for. The continuous development throughout the year and major update annually provides incentive enough to renew each year.

Review.Titre: Good tutorials & Conference playback on Kelby
Review.Contenu: As a new ON1 subscriber, I like the helpful email/tutorials very much. On another issue....I don't know if this is yours or Kelby's issue, but on the ON1 Photographers Conference playbacks from your presentations which I access on KelbyOne, the slider panels (etc) are very blurry. I have checked my internet speeds--not sure that is applicable, but my download is 56.88 & upload 20.01, and the blurriness is same on my iMac & my MacBook Pro. Should those speeds be sufficient if indeed that does influence? Any suggestions that either through you or Kelby this is being addressed?

Haven't used 2024 yet, but am looking forward to the updates that will help me be a better photographer. Customer service is fine too.

Review.Contenu: I bought On1 a few years ago but didn't currently have it installed and couldn't find my install software. I sent a message to On1, not expecting to hear from them until after Labor Day. On Labor Day, less than 24 hours after I sent my email, they responded and fixed my problem.Great appreciation for On1's quick response and for solving my problem...in less than 24 hours.

Review.Titre: Pro Max 2024 is magnificent
Review.Contenu: Pro Max 2024 is magnificent. The entire program is full of everything I could ask for. The convenience of final photographs with so advantages that usually take an infinite amount of time and then post editing with PhotoShop to add a few extra; layers to layers and the final touches of a genuine photograph are astounding. I will say that I have a unique photographic skill, one is simple snap shots as a child with a $6.00 Kodak Camera that I bought working at .25 an hour. (Lot of money in those days) and then moving to California to document my journey. While in California I had a total loss of identity because of family. An arms length transaction. In the meantime, I was partially professionally photographing Playboy Style Photography and then getting some nice photographs. As they say, a photographer is recognized for maybe 50 photographs if it goes to a gallery. (1/125 of a second is 250 photos right?) in my life, I have hundreds of photos some miserable and some very well composed. The clarity of a good lens and a nice camera offer total post-production. At 70 years of age, Photography is as good as the "Wasteland" by T. S. Eliot, and as they say "A photograph is worth 1,000 words". In contract space and a contract dollar, I leave the middle ages of a plague and enter the light of the western hemisphere. Something of the feelings of the great photographers and their helpers in the 1840s. Anyway, this program answers it all. Love wins it all. "Beautiful Mind" Russel Crowe + AI (Albert Einstein)

Review.Contenu: Service was very good, however, I’m not a tech savvy person and have struggled a bit with the terminology you used but got there at the end. I’m using MAC and somehow your screen shots were different to mine and after downloading program finding that .dmg file was rather difficult but eventually I got there. Your responses were quick and I appreciate it very much.

Review.Titre: I had a billing issue and contacted…
Review.Contenu: I had a billing issue and contacted customer service via ON1's website. I  expected it would take several days to hear back with any kind of an answer but, to my delight and satisfaction, the issue was addressed and resolved inside of 48 hours. And I reached out on a Saturday over the weekend. Now that's customer service ! I've been an ON1 user for nearly 10 years now, or just about since the company came to market here in the US, and have watched their amazing evolution of their product lines and love their program having now switched over to ON1 from my beloved Aperture v. 3 ( remember those guys ? ). To be honest I was reluctant ( fearful ? ) to let Aperture go as I used it for so long for my business but the latest iterations of 0N1 have made me forget Apples A3 quickly. If you are looking for a processing program to switch over to like I was, look no further. Not only is ON1 "Everything" simply amazing on every level I can now vouch for their customer service as being top notch and super responsive and for me that speaks volumes about the company and where they are taking it to theprofessional consumers like me. Thanks ON1 and bring on ON1 2024 "Max", can't hardly wait ! - Richard Meseroll -
